docs.abstract: Republicans capped a popular deduction for state and local taxes to pay for the tax bill. That may have hurt some House Republicans in the midterms.
docs.snippet: Republicans capped a popular deduction for state and local taxes to pay for the tax bill. That may have hurt some House Republicans in the midterms.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s $1.5 trillion tax cut was supposed to be a big selling point for congressional Republicans in the midterm elections. Instead, it appears to have done more to hurt than help Republicans in high-tax districts across California, New Jersey, Virginia and other states.

headline.main: Did a Tax Increase Tucked Into Trump’s Tax Cut Come Back to Bite Republicans?
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Curb To Deduction Had a Sting In Midterms

byline.original: By Jim Tankersley and Ben Casselman

docs.abstract: Marc Elias, a veteran of high-stakes political battles, is a powerful behind-the-scenes operator who has faced criticism from both left and right.
docs.snippet: Marc Elias, a veteran of high-stakes political battles, is a powerful behind-the-scenes operator who has faced criticism from both left and right.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — He has been accused of rigging the 2016 Democratic presidential primaries to thwart Bernie Sanders and facilitating a deluge of big money into politics. He helped arrange financing for the dossier of sometimes salacious and unverified claims about President Trump’s ties to Russia and now is under direct fire from the president, who has said he is trying to steal the Senate race in Florida from the Republican candidate, Gov. Rick Scott.

headline.main: In Florida Recount Fight, Democratic Lawyer Draws Plaudits and Fire
headline.print_headline: Legal Pugilist for Democrats at Center of Recount Fight in Florida

byline.original: By Kenneth P. Vogel and Patricia Mazzei

docs.abstract: Asked whether a soldier might be armed while defending border agents from migrants, the defense secretary was unequivocal. “No,” he said. “Not with a firearm.”
docs.snippet: Asked whether a soldier might be armed while defending border agents from migrants, the defense secretary was unequivocal. “No,” he said. “Not with a firearm.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Defense Secretary Jim Mattis said on Wednesday that American troops stationed at the southwest border would not be armed with guns to confront incoming migrants, despite a White House directive that aims to protect border security officials by pairing them with military forces.

headline.main: American Troops at Border Won’t Have Guns, Mattis Says

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

docs.abstract: The Chinese police are barring Victor and Cynthia Liu from leaving China in an effort to force their father to return. U.S. officials object to the growing practice of an “exit ban.”
docs.snippet: The Chinese police are barring Victor and Cynthia Liu from leaving China in an effort to force their father to return. U.S. officials object to the growing practice of an “exit ban.”
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When Victor and Cynthia Liu landed with their mother on a tropical Chinese island in June to visit an ailing grandfather, they thought they would soon be on a plane back to their East Coast lives — he to start his sophomore year at Georgetown University, and she to work at the consulting firm McKinsey & Company in New York.

headline.main: China’s Tactic to Catch a Fugitive Official: Hold His Two American Children
headline.print_headline: American Kin Are ‘Collateral’ In China Case

byline.original: By Edward Wong and Michael Forsythe

docs.abstract: American accusations of economic espionage by China could shape negotiations over a trade deal.
docs.snippet: American accusations of economic espionage by China could shape negotiations over a trade deal.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When President Trump and President Xi Jinping of China sit down to talk trade this week at the Group of 20 summit meeting, their negotiations are likely to be framed by a highly charged topic: the White House’s insistence that China routinely steals American technology and intellectual property.

headline.main: Intellectual Property to Take Center Stage as Trump and Xi Meet
headline.print_headline: Inside the Deep Rift Over U.S.-China Trade

docs.abstract: Legislators have introduced bipartisan bills that urge the Trump administration to impose economic sanctions and take other measures to defend Uighurs.
docs.snippet: Legislators have introduced bipartisan bills that urge the Trump administration to impose economic sanctions and take other measures to defend Uighurs.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Lawmakers in Washington are trying to compel the Trump administration to take strong measures against Chinese officials for their mass repression of ethnic Uighurs and other Muslims in China.

headline.main: Lawmakers Push Trump to Act Against China on Uighur Detention
headline.print_headline: Trump Urged to Punish Beijing for Abusing Uighurs

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

docs.abstract: The soldiers’ fathers accused the kingdom of falsely telling the news media that the Green Berets had provoked the deadly shooting by a base guard.
docs.snippet: The soldiers’ fathers accused the kingdom of falsely telling the news media that the Green Berets had provoked the deadly shooting by a base guard.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The families of three Army Special Forces soldiers who were fatally shot by a Jordanian base guard in 2016 said on Friday that they had sued the kingdom over false accusations that the Green Berets provoked the killings — accounts disputed by a video of the attack.

headline.main: Families Sue Jordan Over 2016 Deaths of 3 U.S. Green Berets
headline.print_headline: U.S. Families Sue Jordan  Over Deaths of 3 Soldiers

keywords.value: United States Army Special Forces (Green Berets)

docs.abstract: The death of Sgt. Jason M. McClary makes the roadside bombing that killed him and three others the deadliest attack on American troops in Afghanistan since 2015.
docs.snippet: The death of Sgt. Jason M. McClary makes the roadside bombing that killed him and three others the deadliest attack on American troops in Afghanistan since 2015.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A fourth soldier has died as a result of a roadside bomb in central Afghanistan last week, the Pentagon announced on Monday, marking the episode as the single largest loss of American life in the war since 2015.

headline.main: Fourth Soldier Dies After Coordinated Bomb Blast in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: 4th Soldier Hurt by Bomb From Taliban Has Died

docs.abstract: In retirement, the 41st and 43rd presidents could finally focus on the things that parents and children focus on when the parent grows older.
docs.snippet: In retirement, the 41st and 43rd presidents could finally focus on the things that parents and children focus on when the parent grows older.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Theirs was a relationship of Shakespearean dimensions, father and son occupants of the Oval Office. A son who grew up struggling to live up to the example of the great man. A father who watched his eldest boy eventually take his place in the seat of power, his love unquestioned but his advice unwelcome.

headline.main: For George Bush and His Eldest Son, a Relationship Unique Among American Presidents
headline.print_headline: Free of the Mantles of 41 and 43, They Settled Back Into Father and Son

docs.abstract: Canada and Mexico want the Trump metal tariffs lifted, but the administration is trying to limit the amount of foreign steel to prevent a flood of cheap metals into the United States.
docs.snippet: Canada and Mexico want the Trump metal tariffs lifted, but the administration is trying to limit the amount of foreign steel to prevent a flood of cheap metals into the United States.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A potential deal to ease President Trump’s metal tariffs on Mexico and Canada is being complicated by the Trump administration’s push to place strict quotas on imported steel from the two trading partners.

headline.main: U.S. Weighs Steel Quotas, Instead of Tariffs, on Canada and Mexico
headline.print_headline: U.S. Steel Quotas Could Create New Tensions With Canada

byline.original: By Alan Rappeport and Glenn Thrush
